metaTags.metaTitle: Business Email Compromise (BEC) Phishing Attack Trends in 2022
metaTags.metaDescription: How to Stop Business Email Compromise Threats from Cloudflare Area 1 covers the current state of BEC attacks. What makes BEC just as financially damaging as ransomware. Why BEC is successful at evading traditional email defenses. The industries most targeted by BEC attacks. Advanced email security techniques to block all BEC types.

relatedBlades.title: How to Stop Business Email Compromise Threats
relatedBlades.subtitle: BEC in 2022: Advanced Techniques for Fighting Financial Phishing
relatedBlades.copy:
![Business Email Banner](//cf-assets.www.cloudflare.com/slt3lc6tev37/2UcBA0cq1otUc2Dr6LBSKj/e63779d67a8f3942d27c558615753557/Business-Email-Banner.png)

Business Email Compromise (BEC) is one of the most financially damaging cybercrimes, according to the FBI. Yet many organizations continue to underestimate — and underreport — the severity of BEC threats. 

Discover the current state of BEC attacks, and learn:
- What makes BEC just as financially damaging as ransomware
- Why BEC is so successful at evading traditional email defenses
- Which industries are most targeted by BEC attacks
- Advanced techniques - such as extending Zero Trust to your email security approach - can help block all categories of BEC (including supply chain compromise)
